channel.title: itemDef,class8[unsolved]

item.title: itemDef,class8[unsolved]
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Actually it’s all PI clients.

The method you added didn’t have any ints.

That’s because it didn’t have the switch statement.

As I said, it loads from cases, not if statements.

The only if statements in the code, are for noting, and a boolean to tell if the item is a member object or not.

The ints load from the switch statement.[/quote]
No, really it doesn’t. You can add it any way it doesn’t just load from switch statements.

As you can see,

itemDef.id = i;

So doing,

switch(itemDef.id) {
    ...
}

and

if(i == ...) {
    ...
}

Are the same goddamn thing!

If you wish to tell me that

    public static ItemDef forID(int i)
    {
        for(int j = 0; j < 10; j++)
            if(cache[j].id == i)
                return cache[j];

        cacheIndex = (cacheIndex + 1) % 10;
        ItemDef itemDef = cache[cacheIndex];
        stream.currentOffset = streamIndices[i];
        itemDef.id = i;
        itemDef.setDefaults();
        itemDef.readValues(stream);
        if(itemDef.certTemplateID != -1)
            itemDef.toNote();
        if(!isMembers && itemDef.membersObject)
        {
            itemDef.name = "Members Object";
            itemDef.description = "Login to a members' server to use this object.".getBytes();
            itemDef.groundActions = null;
            itemDef.actions = null;
            itemDef.team = 0;
        }

        if(i == 995) {
            ...
        } 
        return itemDef;
    }

and

    public static ItemDef forID(int i)
    {
        for(int j = 0; j < 10; j++)
            if(cache[j].id == i)
                return cache[j];

        cacheIndex = (cacheIndex + 1) % 10;
        ItemDef itemDef = cache[cacheIndex];
        stream.currentOffset = streamIndices[i];
        itemDef.id = i;
        itemDef.setDefaults();
        itemDef.readValues(stream);
        if(itemDef.certTemplateID != -1)
            itemDef.toNote();
        if(!isMembers && itemDef.membersObject)
        {
            itemDef.name = "Members Object";
            itemDef.description = "Login to a members' server to use this object.".getBytes();
            itemDef.groundActions = null;
            itemDef.actions = null;
            itemDef.team = 0;
        }
        switch(itemDef.id) {
            case 995:
                 ...
            break;
        }
        return itemDef;
    }

Are different, then you sir need to learn a bit more Java.

Read full topic

item.title: itemDef,class8[unsolved]
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Yours doesn’t have the switch statement.

Here is my ItemDef forID method.

public static ItemDef forID(int i) { for(int j = 0; j < 10; j++) if(cache[j].id == i) return cache[j]; cacheIndex = (cacheIndex + 1) % 10; ItemDef itemDef = cache[cacheIndex]; stream.currentOffset = streamIndices[i]; itemDef.id = i; itemDef.setDefaults(); itemDef.readValues(stream); if(itemDef.certTemplateID != -1) itemDef.toNote(); if(!isMembers && itemDef.membersObject) { itemDef.name = "Members Object"; itemDef.description = "Login to a members' server to use this object.".getBytes(); itemDef.groundActions = null; itemDef.actions = null; itemDef.team = 0; } switch (itemDef.id) { case 11722: itemDef.femaleEquip1 = itemDef.maleEquip1; itemDef.femaleEquip2 = itemDef.maleEquip2; break; case 11777: itemDef.actions = new String[5]; itemDef.actions[1] = "Wield"; itemDef.modelID = 44590; itemDef.maleEquip1 = 43660;//anInt165 itemDef.femaleEquip1 = 43660;//anInt200 itemDef.modelZoom = 789; itemDef.modelRotation1 = 240; itemDef.modelRotation2 = 60; itemDef.modelOffset1 = -1; itemDef.modelOffset2 = -23; itemDef.name = "Dragon claws"; itemDef.description = "A set of fighting claws.".getBytes(); break; case 13738: itemDef.actions = new String[5]; itemDef.actions[1] = "Wield"; itemDef.modelID = 8001; itemDef.modelZoom = 1616; itemDef.modelRotation1 = 396; itemDef.modelRotation2 = 1050; itemDef.modelOffset1 = -3; itemDef.modelOffset2 = 4; itemDef.maleEquip1 = 9001; itemDef.femaleEquip1 = 9001; itemDef.name = "Arcane spirit shield"; itemDef.description = "It's a Arcane spirit shield.".getBytes(); break; case 13744: itemDef.actions = new String[5]; itemDef.actions[1] = "Wield"; itemDef.modelID = 8000; itemDef.modelZoom = 1616; itemDef.modelRotation1 = 396; itemDef.modelRotation2 = 1050; itemDef.modelOffset1 = -3; itemDef.modelOffset2 = 4; itemDef.maleEquip1 = 9000; itemDef.femaleEquip1 = 9000; itemDef.name = "Spectral spirit shield"; itemDef.description = "It's a Spectral spirit shield.".getBytes(); break; case 13740: itemDef.actions = new String[5];//menu itemDef.actions[1] = "Wield"; itemDef.modelID = 8002; itemDef.modelZoom = 1616; itemDef.modelRotation1 = 396; itemDef.modelRotation2 = 1050; itemDef.modelOffset1 = -3; itemDef.modelOffset2 = 4; itemDef.maleEquip1 = 9002; itemDef.femaleEquip1 = 9002; itemDef.name = "Divine spirit shield"; itemDef.description = "It's a Divine spirit shield.".getBytes(); break; case 13734: itemDef.actions = new String[5]; itemDef.actions[1] = "Wield"; itemDef.modelID = 8003; itemDef.modelZoom = 1616; itemDef.modelRotation1 = 396; itemDef.modelRotation2 = 1050; itemDef.modelOffset1 = -3; itemDef.modelOffset2 = 4; itemDef.maleEquip1 = 9003; itemDef.femaleEquip1 = 9003; itemDef.name = "Spirit shield"; itemDef.description = "It's a Spirit shield.".getBytes(); break; case 13736: itemDef.actions = new String[5]; itemDef.actions[1] = "Wield"; itemDef.modelID = 40913; itemDef.modelZoom = 1616; itemDef.modelRotation1 = 396; itemDef.modelRotation2 = 1050; itemDef.modelOffset1 = -3; itemDef.modelOffset2 = 4; itemDef.maleEquip1 = 40941; itemDef.femaleEquip1 = 40941; itemDef.name = "Blessed spirit shield"; itemDef.description = "It's a Blessed spirit shield.".getBytes(); break; case 13742: itemDef.actions = new String[5]; itemDef.actions[1] = "Wield"; itemDef.modelID = 8004; itemDef.modelZoom = 1616; itemDef.modelRotation1 = 396; itemDef.modelRotation2 = 1050; itemDef.modelOffset1 = -3; itemDef.modelOffset2 = 4; itemDef.maleEquip1 = 9004; itemDef.femaleEquip1 = 9004; itemDef.name = "Elysian spirit shield"; itemDef.description = "It's an Elysian spirit shield.".getBytes(); break; } return itemDef; } [/quote]
So then it’s not THE ItemDef class goes on a switch statement, it’s yours

I guess it varies from client to client.

itemDef.modelOffset2 = 4; itemDef.maleEquip1 = 40941; itemDef.femaleEquip1 = 40941; itemDef.name = "Blessed spirit shield"; itemDef.description = "It's a Blessed spirit shield.".getBytes(); break; case 13742: itemDef.actions = new String[5]; itemDef.actions[1] = "Wield"; itemDef.modelID = 8004; itemDef.modelZoom = 1616; itemDef.modelRotation1 = 396; itemDef.modelRotation2 = 1050; itemDef.modelOffset1 = -3; itemDef.modelOffset2 = 4; itemDef.maleEquip1 = 9004; itemDef.femaleEquip1 = 9004; itemDef.name = "Elysian spirit shield"; itemDef.description = "It's an Elysian spirit shield.".getBytes(); break; } [/quote]
No. It doesn’t.

    public static ItemDef forID(int i)
    {
        for(int j = 0; j < 10; j++)
            if(cache[j].id == i)
                return cache[j];

        cacheIndex = (cacheIndex + 1) % 10;
        ItemDef itemDef = cache[cacheIndex];
        stream.currentOffset = streamIndices[i];
        itemDef.id = i;
        itemDef.setDefaults();
        itemDef.readValues(stream);
        if(itemDef.certTemplateID != -1)
            itemDef.toNote();
        if(!isMembers && itemDef.membersObject)
        {
            itemDef.name = "Members Object";
            itemDef.description = "Login to a members' server to use this object.".getBytes();
            itemDef.groundActions = null;
            itemDef.actions = null;
            itemDef.team = 0;
        }
        return itemDef;
    }

item.title: itemDef,class8[unsolved]
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

Replace your method460 (Model.java) with this one.

public static void method460(byte[] abyte0, int j) {
        boolean newFormat = abyte0[abyte0.length - 1] == -1 && abyte0[abyte0.length - 2] == -1;
        if (abyte0 == null) {
            Class21 class21 = aClass21Array1661[j] = new Class21();
            class21.anInt369 = 0;
            class21.anInt370 = 0;
            class21.anInt371 = 0;
            return;
        }
        Stream class30_sub2_sub2 = new Stream(abyte0);
        class30_sub2_sub2.currentOffset = abyte0.length - (!newFormat ? 18 : 23);
        Class21 class21_1 = aClass21Array1661[j] = new Class21();
        class21_1.aByteArray368 = abyte0;
        class21_1.anInt369 = class30_sub2_sub2.readUnsignedWord();
        class21_1.anInt370 = class30_sub2_sub2.readUnsignedWord();
        class21_1.anInt371 = class30_sub2_sub2.readUnsignedByte();
        int k = class30_sub2_sub2.readUnsignedByte();
        int l = class30_sub2_sub2.readUnsignedByte();
        int i1 = class30_sub2_sub2.readUnsignedByte();
        int j1 = class30_sub2_sub2.readUnsignedByte();
        int k1 = class30_sub2_sub2.readUnsignedByte();
        if (newFormat) {
            int ignore = class30_sub2_sub2.readUnsignedByte();
        }
        int l1 = class30_sub2_sub2.readUnsignedWord();
        int i2 = class30_sub2_sub2.readUnsignedWord();
        int j2 = class30_sub2_sub2.readUnsignedWord();
        int k2 = class30_sub2_sub2.readUnsignedWord();
        if (newFormat) {
            int ignore = class30_sub2_sub2.readUnsignedWord();
        }
